papers.title: Deep Hedging
papers.affiliation: JP Morgan (authors note opinions are their own)
papers.abstract: Framework for hedging portfolios of derivatives in the presence of market frictions such as transaction costs, market impact, liquidity constraints or risk limits using modern deep reinforcement machine learning methods.

key_equations.pnl: P&L = -Z + Σ δ_k(S_{k+1} - S_k) - Σ κ|δ_{k+1} - δ_k|
key_equations.indifference_price: q(Z) = (1/λ) log(sup_{δ∈H} E[U(-Z + (δ·S)_T + C_T(δ))] / sup_{δ∈H} E[U((δ·S)_T + C_T(δ))])

key_claims: Algorithm is model-free and greek-free
Scales to high-dimensional hedging problems
Outperforms complete market solution under transaction costs
Computational performance invariant to portfolio size
Close-to-optimal strategies using neural network approximation

papers.title: Deep learning approach to hedging
papers.degree: MSc in Mathematical and Computational Finance
papers.abstract: Application of deep learning to hedging derivatives under market frictions. Focus on RNN/LSTM architectures with two-stage training.

key_methodology.critical_observation: Delta bounding with tanh prevents training explosion

key_claims: LSTM outperforms simple RNN for hedging
Two-stage training improves convergence
No-transaction band reduces turnover while maintaining risk
Delta bounding is critical for stable training

papers.title: Robust deep hedging
affiliations: Department of Quantitative Finance, University of Freiburg
papers.abstract: Pricing and hedging under parameter uncertainty for generalized affine processes including Black-Scholes and CEV models. Links nonlinear expectation to Kolmogorov equation for fast numerical pricing in robust framework.

key_methodology.key_insight: Deep hedging under parameter uncertainty via nonlinear expectation

key_equations.robust_pricing: Based on variational form of Kolmogorov equation
key_equations.uncertainty_set: Parameter uncertainty in affine process class

key_claims: Robust deep hedging outperforms standard approaches in volatile periods
Method handles parameter uncertainty explicitly
Applicable to Black-Scholes, CEV, and affine models

papers.title: Hedging with memory: shallow and deep learning with signatures
papers.abstract: Investigation of path signatures in machine learning for hedging exotic derivatives under non-Markovian stochastic volatility models. Shows signatures outperform LSTMs with orders of magnitude less training compute.

key_methodology.key_insight: Signatures provide universal representation for path-dependent payoffs without recurrence

key_claims: Signatures outperform LSTMs with less training compute
Calibrated signature volatility model yields accurate hedging
Effective for exotic path-dependent derivatives

papers.title: SigFormer: Signature Transformers for Deep Hedging
papers.abstract: Combines path signatures with Transformer attention for deep hedging. Uses self-attention on signature terms at different truncation orders.

key_methodology.architecture: Multi-layer attention on Sig^1(X), Sig^2(X), ..., Sig^J(X) terms
key_methodology.key_insight: Treats signature terms individually with different attention weights

key_claims: SigFormer outperforms semi-recurrent RNN approach
Effective for non-Markovian rough volatility
Parallelizable unlike RNNs

papers.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning Algorithms for Option Hedging
papers.abstract: Comprehensive comparison of 8 DRL algorithms for dynamic hedging: MCPG, PPO, TD3, DQL, DDPG, Dueling DQL, DD DQL, Double DQL. Uses GJR-GARCH(1,1) market model.
key_claims: MCPG obtains best performance overall
PPO second best with good stability
MCPG only algorithm to outperform BS delta baseline
All experiments on Nvidia A100 GPU

papers.title: Deep Hedging Under Market Frictions: A Comparison of DRL Models for Options Hedging with Impact and Transaction Costs
papers.abstract: Investigates RL algorithms for hedging under realistic market frictions including permanent market impact, execution slippage, and transaction costs. Compares DDPG, TD3, and SAC.

key_methodology.approach: Deep RL with Market Impact Modeling
key_methodology.market_impact_model: M(A_t) = sign(A_t) * Y * β * sqrt(|A_t|/V), Y ~ clip(N(0,1), -1, 1)

key_claims: TD3 and SAC outperform BS delta hedging by 2/3 in expected losses
SAC achieves 50% reduction in CVaR
TD3 best for low-friction environments
SAC best for high-impact environments

neural_architectures.name: Semi-Recurrent Network (Buehler)
neural_architectures.description: Per-timestep MLP with shared weights, previous delta as input

neural_architectures.name: LSTM Hedger (Kozyra)
neural_architectures.description: Multi-layer LSTM with delta bounding via tanh

dro_methods.name: Robust Deep Hedging
dro_methods.uncertainty: Parameter uncertainty in affine process class

steps: 1. Generate N sample paths from market model
2. For each path, compute features I_k at each timestep
3. Forward pass: δ_k = F_θ(I_k, δ_{k-1}) for k=0,...,n-1
4. Compute P&L = -Z + Σ δ_k(S_{k+1} - S_k) - costs
6. Backpropagate and update θ using Adam
